body.p:
Newcastle Henry Co Ky
August 27th 1862
Hon J F Robinson
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir --

I write you at the request of some of the most earnest and practical Loyal men of this county requesting if practical that about 100 -- efficient mounted men be kept in this county for some days -- or until those now engaged in scouting for the confederate rebels -- shall be caught or routed -- This has been going on with an a remarkable activity -- being adjacent to Trimble and Owen -- they have had a pretty clear -- I have had since here a fair oportunity to hear and learn and I assure you sir this is no hobgoblin -- but an actuality -- and the rebel Jessee -- we thought killed has been
successful at work here up to last Sunday night -- There are many hiding places on the border of Owen -- and Trimble and many think he is yet skulking here. The few union men of Trimble have been agrieved by the uneven and the untimely action of Dickens a Provost from this county who in a mistaken zeal (to say the least) has given to the recruiting Rebels a new impulse -- and it is telling in the members of recruits -- The troops now here under -- Holman we have not heard from -- but they were too late for the Locality they were sent to -- This place should be the head quarters -- and work out from here in squads -- There are a number of efficient men here to cooperate with them but some permanent organization is necessary as a for them --

I do hope my dear sir that your health will be equal to the demands that are upon you and that God will favor this this commonwealth in a kind providence over you, and this is the prayer of scores
and hundreds of loyal hearts all over this land -- Mrs B joins in regards to you --
